articles.description: Follow live commentary, score and text updates as Everton play Newcastle and Tottenham face West Ham in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Everton v Newcastle plus Spurs v West Ham - radio & text

articles.description: A stoppage-time goal condemns Santos, Brazil legend Pele's former club, to their first relegation from the top flight.
articles.title: Pele's former club Santos relegated for first time

articles.description: Erik ten Hag says friends tried to talk him out of taking over as Manchester United manager because they thought he faced an "impossible job".
articles.title: 'Friends tried to talk me out of Man Utd job' - Ten Hag

articles.description: Formula 1's governing body ends its compliance inquiry into Mercedes team boss Toto Wolff and F1 Academy director Susie Wolff.
articles.title: FIA ends controversial inquiry into Toto and Susie Wolff

articles.description: As he lay in a hospital bed recovering from a stroke, Matt Crossen was prepared for the physical battle to return to the football pitch. The mental challenge was more of a surprise.
articles.title: 'If I didn't have my stroke, would I be playing for England?’

articles.description: Rafael Nadal receives a direct entry to the Australian Open after nearly a year out, while Nick Kyrgios looks set to miss the tournament in January because of injury.
articles.title: Nadal included on Australian Open entry list

articles.description: Cameroon international Bryan Mbeumo will be sidelined for weeks with a 'bad' ankle injury, says manager Thomas Frank.
articles.title: Brentford forward Mbeumo sidelined for weeks

articles.description: Luka Doncic scores a first-half triple-double to help the Dallas Mavericks to a convincing 147-97 victory over the Utah Jazz.
articles.title: Doncic scores 40 points as Mavericks thrash Jazz

articles.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu will make her comeback to the tennis tour in Auckland in the first week of January.
articles.title: Raducanu to make comeback in Auckland in January

articles.description: Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James says the lack of change on gun control in the USA is "ridiculous", after three people were killed in a shooting at the University of Nevada.
articles.title: Lack of action on US gun control 'ridiculous' - James
